page.title: 15"PEMBROKESHIRE" CLIMATE
page.content: Pembrokeshire's early vegetables are a clue to the local climate. {Spring}comes earlier here than in most of the UK. {May and June}are usually drier months and the locals enjoy their first summertime visits "down the beach". This area is also one of the sunniest in Wales and Tourism is an important industry. The mean{July temperature is only 16 C,though, because of the sea's influence. {Autumn}days are often cool with mists over the Haven in the early mornings, although there are few days with fog because of the winds. The{winters}are mild - 6 C, but wet and windy with most winds coming from the open Atlantic to the south-west. A truly{"Maritime Climate". by Eileen Seal
